properties.name: 7A
properties.description: Posted by Diegoclau7th st and Avenue A new yorkLove this East Village place for brunch. There\'s a 0 brunch menu that includes coffee, a cocktail, and food. They have several outstanding varieties of eggs benedict, and an amazing breakfast burrito. There\'s always a wait on Sundays at brunch time. They\'re also open 24 hours.

properties.name: Bluestockings
properties.description: Posted by Diegoclau 172 Allen St, New York, NYLefty/radical/anarchist cooperative bookshop and performance space.

properties.name: Cheapest dumplings ever
properties.description: Posted by Diegoclau46 Eldridge St. New York, NY 10002This is an incredible place. Fresh, handmade dumplings, boiled or fried, filled with pork, veggies, or other things. Five for one dollar. Most expensive item on the menu costs three bucks.

properties.name: DT-UT
properties.description: Posted by Diegoclau    1626 2nd Avenue, New York, NY 10028A cool and unusual Cafe, DT-UT offers a wonderful gathering place for the stroller set and for parents with young children. The long, deep space, with vintage overstuffed armchairs and sofas pushed back against the walls or in open clusters, offers plenty of room to manoeuver strollers or for toddlers to move around. The style might be described as a cross between your living room and the set for a Cocteau movie. (GoCityKids)

properties.name: Eat tapas where Lorca did
properties.description: Posted by Diegoclau 239 W. 14th St New York, NYTheir tapas are excellent and they accomodated a group of 18 for my birthday. I thought that the paella was mediocre.

properties.name: El Faro
properties.description: Posted by Diegoclau823 Greenwich St 10014Small and intimate Spanish restaurant with great tapas, paella, and sangria. A terriffic place for a romantic date as well as for a group celebration.

properties.description: Posted by Diegoclau 186 avenue b 10009Fabulous neighborhood pizzeria - thin-crust pizza, high-quality ingredients, good beer, and a terriffic plate of antipasti.

properties.name: Republic
properties.description: Posted by Diegoclau37 Union Square West 10003Pan-Asian noodle restaurant and bar. Some great cocktails, entrees around 0. Thai, Chinese, Japanese, Vietnamese dishes and ingredients.

properties.name: Rue B
properties.description: Posted by Diegoclau12th street and avenue B, new york, NYRue B is our favorite brunch deal in New York! Funky atmosphere, delicious food, great value on brunch. Truffled eggs and eggs Corleone are two of our favorites. On Sundays, we get the extra treat of spotting the same two beautiful Australian models.

properties.name: Saurin Parke Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Diegoclau  301 W. 110th St New York, NYRoomy, attractive, literary-themed coffee shop with giant lattes and free Wi-Fi, right off Frederick Douglass Circle.

properties.name: Shalel
properties.description: Posted by Diegoclau65 W 70th St 10023Half-hidden and fairly sexy Moroccan restaurant/lounge, with stone walls, secluded niches, and candlelight. Great tahini, humus, babaganous, etc. Drinks a bit pricey (beers - 5).
